title: These Beauty Products Ruled the Grammys - and Cost Under $40
description: When it comes to sourcing new beauty inspiration, we can always count on the Grammys to introduce us to a new product or show-stopping trend. This year's ceremony not only saw the return of some old favorites - like Taylor Swift's trusted red lip and the controversial jellyfish haircut - but it also introduced us to a slew of new celeb-approved beauty products, including some affordable surprises (we're talking under $40!). While celebrity glam is more typically associated with high-end, luxury beauty products, many celebrities opted to use more budget-friendly products for their Grammys 2025 looks. Cynthia Erivo used a $5 eyeliner to create her decadent, mocha-hued eye contour; Charli XCX tamed her voluminous curls with the help of a $9 styling creme; and even Miley Cyrus relied on an $11 lip tint to perfect her award-show pout. Ahead, we rounded up the best affordable beauty products under $40 that music's biggest stars relied on for the 2025 Grammys. From drugstore favorites to hair-care staples and plenty of editor-approved skin-care products in between, these beauty must haves will make it easy to achieve an A-list glam - even if you're on a budget. Keep reading to shop our favorite finds and browse through the product categories below: Red Carpet Makeup Products Under $40 Red Carpet Skin-Care Products Under $40 Red Carpet Hair Products Under $40
author: Kyley Warren

html:
While each product featured is independently selected by our editors, we may include paid promotion. If you buy something through our links, we may earn commission. Read more about our Product Review Guidelines here.

When it comes to sourcing new beauty inspiration, we can always count on the Grammys to introduce us to a new product or show-stopping trend. This year's ceremony not only saw the return of some old favorites â€” like Taylor Swift's trusted red lip and the controversial jellyfish haircut â€” but it also introduced us to a slew of new celeb-approved beauty products, including some affordable surprises (we're talking under $40!).

While celebrity glam is more typically associated with high-end, luxury beauty products, many celebrities opted to use more budget-friendly products for their Grammys 2025 looks. Cynthia Erivo used a $5 eyeliner to create her decadent, mocha-hued eye contour; Charli XCX tamed her voluminous curls with the help of a $9 styling creme; and even Miley Cyrus relied on an $11 lip tint to perfect her award-show pout.

Ahead, we rounded up the best affordable beauty products under $40 that music's biggest stars relied on for the 2025 Grammys. From drugstore favorites to hair-care staples and plenty of editor-approved skin-care products in between, these beauty must haves will make it easy to achieve an A-list glam â€” even if you're on a budget. Keep reading to shop our favorite finds and browse through the product categories below:

  • Red Carpet Makeup Products Under $40
  • Red Carpet Skin-Care Products Under $40
  • Red Carpet Hair Products Under $40

Red Carpet Makeup Products

Urban Decay All Nighter Waterproof Makeup Setting Spray ($36)

At the 2025 Grammys, Doechii won big in more ways than one. Besides taking home the Grammy for best rap album, the breakout star also rocked one of the night's best beauty looks. The rapper's makeup artist, Dee Carrion, used several Urban Decay products to achieve her glam, including this setting spray, which helped to keep the star's makeup looking fresh â€” even during her Grammys performance.

Red Carpet Skin-Care Products

Aquaphor Ointment Body Spray ($13)

Newly-minted Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter looked like the belle of the (music?) ball at the 2025 Grammys, where she slipped into a custom, baby blue JW Anderson dress. But it was her complementary glam that really got everyone talking. The star's makeup artist, Carolina Gonzalez, revealed all of the beauty essentials that went into creating Carpenter's "baby angel" look, including this hydrating Aquaphor spray.

Red Carpet Hair Products

Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil ($30)

Willow Smith leaned into her hair's natural texture at the 2025 Grammys, working with celebrity hairstylist Vernon Francois to style a chic, middle-part Afro. Francois revealed that Olaplex's cult-favorite bonding oil was key in prepping the musician's hair and scalp for the event.

For the full product details, read our review of the Olaplex No. 7 Bonding Oil.

Kyley Warren (she/her) is an award-winning writer, editor, and affiliate strategist with more than four years of experience in the publishing space. She currently works as an assistant editor on PS Shopping and is an expert on all things related to shopping and fashion. She previously worked with Entertainment Tonight as a style commerce writer, and her byline has appeared in publications globally.
